intro: Myrsine courboniana, commonly known as the African myrsine, is a shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers followed by red or orange berries. The berries are edible and often used in local cuisines or traditional medicine.
